title: Byju's: NCLAT dismisses appeals by BCCI, Riju Raveendran against NCLT order
summary: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has dismissed appeals filed by the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) and Riju Raveendran challenging a National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) order regarding Byju's settlement.
content:
The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has rejected appeals filed by the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) and Riju Raveendran against an NCLT order concerning Byju's settlement terms. The case relates to ongoing legal proceedings involving the prominent edtech company Byju's.

The NCLT had previously issued an order regarding settlement terms, which was subsequently challenged by both the BCCI and Raveendran. However, the NCLAT has now upheld the original NCLT decision by dismissing these appeals.

content.title: HUL tells Delhi High Court it will remove Lakme sunscreen ad disparaging Derma Co
content.content:
Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL), which owns the Lakme brand, on Thursday informed the Delhi High Court that it will withdraw and republish its advertisements after removing references that allegedly disparage Honasa Consumer Limited’s Derma Co brand.
